items.content_html:
Noticed on the Husky PR that there was one minor Prettier thing with one of the new scripts.
Added script to format/fix along with a CI based on the other PR checks
items.title: chore: Add CI and scripts for js formatting

items.content_html:
Return a new array in doubling example instead of mutating the previousValue

Description

Changed the doubling example to not modify the previousValue argument. If this change makes the example too confusing (need to understand spread operator, logic seems slightly more complex) I understand. If this is an acceptable change, I can modify the PR to fix this elsewhere

Motivation

This is more inline with how many popular linters will make users change their code, and is more "functional" in nature

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Don't modify the function argument

items.content_html:
Description

let and const don't create any properties, delete operator return false because bindings defined with let and const has environment record [[Base]]
items.title: fix deleting non-configurable properties section

items.content_html:
Description

This change removes the experimental flag from the externally_connectable manifest key and adds clarification about the APIs that can be used to send messages from webpages to extensions. Also, references to the function of externally_connectable are added to runtime.sendMessage(), runtime.onMessageExternal, and runtime.connect().

Motivation

Complete work started in #19838
items.title: externally_connectable doc improvements

items.content_html:
• Document content script CSP ( https://bugzil.la/1581611 ).
  • Clarify what CSP covers (not just <script>).
  • Clarify role of object-src ( https://bugzil.la/1766881 , https://crbug.com/1320785). +w3c/webextensions#204
  • Clarify what is considered a secure source for MV2 and MV3.
  • Remove localhost ( https://bugzil.la/1789751 ).
  • Remove "valid" examples that are actually not valid MV3 examples.
  • Add formatting to style invalid examples as "example-bad".
items.title: Fix inaccuracies in extension CSP documentation

items.content_html:
Description

Follow-up to #20358. It was proposed to add a note to all APIs that require user activation. I was considering to add a notecard banner to these pages but many pages already use too many banners and I don't want to add to that callout business on the pages [1]. So, I thought it might be wise to introduce a section called "Security" where we could mention all security related aspects of APIs. I did that in this PR. Let me know if that's okay.

[1] https://twitter.com/ddbeck/status/1509925868021420042

Motivation

I was motivated by this comment #20358 (comment).

Related issues and pull requests

This also contributes to the request made at openwebdocs/project#73.
items.title: Add a security section to APIs that require user activation

Came upon this page, and updated it.

Removed font and bgcolor, which people don't need to know every existed.
added a label to a form control, since the error was not explained in the surrounding text.
Added a description on how to write alt attributes
removed longdesc; longdesc was discussed in 2003, and is still not implemented, so no need to mention it as people likely won't come across it.

items.title: style: run prettier on webassembly

items.content_html:
https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/CSS/-webkit-box-reflect is supposed to be emulated by using element (see warning panel on page webkit-box-reflect ) This is not easy to do. I came up with this solution :
duplicate image using element
position it :after current image (this does not work, so I got to use a container)
use absolute positionning
flip it (scaleY(-1))
use margin-top as an offset
use a mask image and a gradient for a shaded reflection

I think this is a decent emulation of -webkit-box-reflect that should be shared.

Description

Firefox lacks -webkit-box-reflect

Motivation

Give the reader a starter about how to emulate it using "element"

Additional details

if someone came with a better solution that works with class instead of id, I'll be glad to hear about it

Related issues and pull requests
items.title: Add box-reflect polyfill for browsers not supporting -webkit-box-reflect

items.content_html:
Description

Rewrite the page to use addEventListener rather than HTML event attributes, and have a better example in "Specifying drop targets". This PR replaces #20048.

But also a bit of yak-shaving:

  • remove some Firefox-only stuff (:-moz-drag-over and XUL(!))
  • sentence case for headings

I used Prettier so it has also reformatted other code samples. I hope that is OK.

Motivation

Better practice code samples.

Related issues and pull requests

Relates to #20048.
items.title: Fixes to drag operations page

items.content_html:
Description

Adds a fieldset and legend element to each form used in the radio button examples.

Motivation

To improve the accessibility and clarity of the examples and to promote good web development practices.

Additional details

Related issues and pull requests

Fixes #20342
items.title: Adds fieldset and legend to radio button examples

items.content_html:
Will run Prettier/Markdownlint if the contributor is running locally.
It may be too early to run the Prettier hook, as it will cause many changes in some files if it's being formatted for the first time

items.content_html:
Description

Expands the docs a bit to tell more about transient and sticky user activation.

Motivation

I was motivated by this request: openwebdocs/project#73

Additional details

Here's the spec: https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/interaction.html#tracking-user-activation

Dom has a great tool to search in specs, so I used that to find APIs that use user activation.
https://dontcallmedom.github.io/webdex/t.html#Transient%20activation%40%40html%25%25dfn
https://dontcallmedom.github.io/webdex/s.html#Sticky%20activation%40%40html%25%25dfn
items.title: Add some docs about transient and sticky user activation

items.content_html:
Description

Removed the leading spaces before Infinity. This is explained earlier.
Removed trailing spaces being ignored. This is also explained earlier.

Motivation

Some of the behavior with Infinity and trailing spaces can be explained by the first rule. This is to avoid redundancy.

Related issues and pull requests

#16596

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Edit parseFloat() behavior with Infinity and trailing spaces.

items.content_html:
Summary

Added another (and potentially more relevant) use case for integer multiplication.

Motivation

Found Math.imul() to be a life saver for hash computations, where I got many hash conflicts by using standard (floating point) multiplication.

Supporting details

https://github.com/mike-lischke/a4tstool/blob/master/lib/MurmurHash.ts

Related issues

Metadata

  • Adds a new document
  • Rewrites (or significantly expands) a document
  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error
items.title: Add example with Math.imul
